Title: End User Engineer
Content:
Group Details:

The Client Infrastructure Services team carries out engineering, integration and 24 x 7 support activities required to provide a robust and reliable desktop Infrastructure for a dynamic trading and investment oriented environment at Tradeweb. The end user engineer role requires assets such as adaptability and flexibility, as systems are based not only locally in London but in other geographical sites. The role supports a highly demanding customer based that is heavily reliant on technology to compete in an extremely volatile business. End User engineering will be focused on all Asian endpoint management and support. All responsibilities carried out in accordance with Code of Conduct, Tradeweb Values and Guiding Principles ensuring adherence to Privacy principles.

Job Responsibilities:Technical Direction & Services

Support local user base and provide remote support to regional offices.
Monitor & review IT practices & procedures aligning with the information security policy. Identify non-compliant practices and assist with remediation.
Maintain accurate endpoint inventories with regular audits.
OS & application security patching.
Maintain and support desktop platform images, software packages.
Remediate incidents within defined Service Level Agreement guidelines.
Work with Cyber Security, IT Compliance & Risk Management to maintain low operational risk.
Travel as necessary to assist with global collaboration, and projects.
Excellent understanding of Systems Management
Excellent understanding of patching products, process and best practices.
Excellent scripting Skills VB, PowerShell, and SQL.
Experience testing certifying and weighting hardware and software technology products.
Experience with Active Directory scripting and Administration.
Knowledge of Supporting Windows endpoint technology
Knowledge of Supporting MacOS / iOS devices
Knowledge of Support Virtual Desktops VMWare, Citrix and AppSense
Knowledge of Supporting Windows Server technology (Physical and Virtual)
Knowledge of Supporting blade technology
Day to day support of end users
Automation
Installation of hardware, software applications, security updates, service packs, etc.
Understanding of networking principles, practices and technologies, especially the TCP/IP protocol suite; preferred working knowledge of DNS, WINS and DHCP.
Active Directory management for user administration, security/group policies and file management.
Seek out industry trends and organization knowledge to understand alternative approaches / solutions.
Think creatively about opportunities to align Tradeweb offerings with future client needs.
Create metrics, monitoring and system reports for a higher level of information, i.e., trends analysis and management of the health of the Intel environment.
Anticipate and quantify tactical, operational and strategic risks, applying risk-based approach to forecasting.
Resolve complex issues and conflicts (including architectural direction vs. project constraints); escalate to executive level where required.
Continuously decrease Tradeweb Infrastructure costs.
Facilitate the integration of technology solutions impacting Intel Infrastructure globally.
Promote innovative or improved methods to get the work done and implements best practices.
Testing and documentation.

Relationships & Communication

Provide superior client experience and strengthen relationship with business partner.
Develop criteria to evaluate 3rd party vendors and software as well as due diligence exercises. For complex projects, conduct due diligence; for less complex projects, oversee the process.
Effectively communicate and build rapport with team members, stakeholders and interface groups using a variety of techniques and collaboration, from initiation to close.
Lead group meetings (including business partners) for technical design, decision making, problem solving, implementation and strategic planning.

Qualifications

Strong understanding of the requirements of supporting Financial Markets Businesses.
Knowledge of principles of Service Management (Support and Delivery).
7-10 years desktop support / engineering experience.
Knowledge of principles of Service Management (Support and Delivery).
Knowledge and understanding of systems life cycles.
Strong grounding in all areas of Infrastructure Technology.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Technologies / Knowledge

Knowledge of relevant Intel Computing technologies including SCCM , VMWare, Citrix, Active Directory, Microsoft Exchange and MS SQL
Multiple platform familiarity, e.g., Grid, Internet, Client/Server, Virtualization, NAS
Knowledge of Microsoft products including Windows 7/10, Windows server O/S, MS Office 2010, 2013 and 2016
Knowledge of IT Standards, Methodologies, audit requirements
Desktop Imaging and Automated Deployment (MDT)
VBS, PowerShell and batch scripting


About Tradeweb:

Tradeweb Markets Inc. (NASDAQ: TW) is a leading, global operator of electronic marketplaces for rates, credit, equities and money markets. Founded in 1996, Tradeweb provides access to markets, data and analytics, electronic trading, straight-through-processing and reporting for clients in the institutional, wholesale and retail markets. Advanced technologies developed by Tradeweb enhance price discovery, order execution and trade workflows while allowing for greater scale and helping to reduce risks in client trading operations. For more information, please go to www.tradeweb.com .
